abstract: General Electric‘s two-year-long effort to buy a stake in the Shenzhen Development Bank failed mainly because many Chinese shareholders believed the planned purchase price was too low, bankers told Reuters on Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: General Electric‘s two-year-long effort to buy a stake in the Shenzhen Development Bank failed mainly because many Chinese shareholders believed the planned purchase price was too low, bankers told Reuters on Wednesday.

headline.main: G.E. Offer for Shenzhen Stake Was Too Low, Report Says
